poem:
Title: In the Realm of the Dime

In the tender arithmetic of the world,
We parse percentages in our morning coffee,
Numbers rise and fall like suns across tea cups,
Every industry a poet counting grains of sand.
Inflation, as elusive as cloud's silver, and just as precious.
From each penny's corner, the world expands,
With the distant hum of the economy
Carving soft echoes through our days.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Of course, that’s way down from what it was back in 2022. But don’t tell that to any of my clients – or people running businesses in just about every industry across the country.
